1.content: This is what matters most, at least at first. Which character would you like to follow?
1.title: The Beginning

11.content: So, you decided to follow me? Excellent. Thank you, I could use the support. Now, I also need help. I need to obtain items that would work for a warrior. I don't like close combat, though, and I would prefer fighting longer-range. Could you please suggest what I should buy before beginning my quest?
11.title: Jessica, the female warrior.

111.content: Okay, I guess.... Like I said, I'm not that good close range, but I'll do my best! Now, one more thing before I get started. Which type of magic should I study during my travels?
111.title: Light Sword and Light Shield

1111.content: I woke up today. I trained long and hard on my White Magic skills yesterday, and I'm barely able to stay awake. I need to get my weapons and armor ready for today, and.... Oh! It's you! Glad you could make it! The evil warlock, Barrington, has kidnapped the prince and is holding him for ransom! The town refused, so now he's attacking with his army of monsters! He'll tear the entire place down unless someone stops him! That's where I come in. I've trained long and hard for the time that an adventurer would be necessary, and it's finally here! Well, I'm gonna head out now. Feel free to follow me. Oh! Right! Which gate should I go through? The northern gate is the one that is heavily guarded by enemies, but closer to the warlock's lair. The southern gate is farther away, but there are many less monsters. Your choice, I don't care.
1111.title: Beginning

choices: Rush the giants and the ogres
Attack the goblins and the birds
11111.content:
OK, so I'm taking the north gate? All right, I'll meet you there.

-------Later-------

"Get the archers back! Send in the frontrunners!"

"I'm here! Took me a while to get everything packed and ready to go."

"Jessica! Finally!"

"Hey, you made it, too! That's great. Hey, quick question. How can you read my mind?"

***Um.... I don't know....***

"I can read yours, too. Interesting."

"Who are you talking to?"

"Oh, right. Never mind, chief. So, what's the situation?"

"Well, there are several different types of monsters out there. Now that you're here, we can just smash them all."

"What should I start with?"

"Your choice."

That means that it's YOUR choice, since I can't decide. Go ahead. Pick from the ones I have listed below...
11111.title: Northern Gate

choices: Cut through the opening and charge toward Barrington's lair
Stay and analyze the enemy situation
111111.content:
All right, you're the boss! I'm gonna charge them, then, right?

Jessica charged towards the giants and the ogres. Their brains, being the size of walnuts at the largest, were far too tiny to understand that she was a threat. She simply rushed in, dodged the lumbering blow, attacked at their side, and took them down, one by one. Meanwhile, the other soldiers attacked the birds and the goblins, and it seemed good that Jessica didn't attack them. The birds would swoop in and take out most of the sword fighters, while the archers would hit the birds mid-air.

All right! They're gone! What's next?
111111.title: Giants and Ogres and Smashing, Oh My!

1111111.content:
All right! Charge toward Barrington himself! Got it!

Jessica did exactly that. She cut through the opening that had been made in the ranks by the warriors. She began approaching Barrington's lair, and Barrington had just sent out more monsters, including a couple of... unique ones. She reached his lair, and was greeted by many, many stone sculptures.

"OK? That's a bit odd..."

Just then, she heard a loud hissing noise from behind her. She turned around, and met the gaze of a creature known as a medusa. Medusas' gazes can turn a human to stone instantly, and she met it right in the eyes.

---------------------------------

Barrington did get his money from the village. He also burned it to the ground for its insolence. Meanwhile, the statue garden of Barrington's lair now has two new additions, the prince and Jessica...
1111111.title: To Barrington!

1111112.content: OK, I'll analyze the positions.... Let's see.... There's a large gap in the enemy forces right down the middle, and it looks like there are a couple of monsters off on the horizon. If I rush them, I might fail, since they look a little bit stronger than those giants and orcs. If I don't rush them, and wait for them, I could get more time to get an accurate reading on them, but I might not reach Barrington by his ultimatum. What should I do?
1111112.title: Analysis Time!

11111121.content:
Okay, again, you're the boss!

Jessica charged at the enemies. Among the ranks of monsters, there were a couple that stood out. Three demons, five dragons and a medusa. A medusa's gaze can turn a mortal to stone. Jessica knew this, and avoided the medusa's gaze at any cost. Of course, she wasn't looking where she was going directly, and ran right into a dragon. The dragon seemed hungry at the time. It decided to eat lunch.

------------------------

Barrington got his money from the village, then burned it to the ground for its insolence. His dragon died of lead poisoning, from eating too much metal in one sitting. The prince, however, had a spell cast on him. One that turned him into a mosquito, and he was then released. One of the villagers, without knowing, killed the prince by mistake. Barrington had won, and turned his sights on the next town...
11111121.title: CHARGE!!!

11111122.content: OK, you need more information to make a decision. That's fine. Let's see.... There are mostly orcs, but there are 3 demons, 5 dragons and a medusa. I'm glad I didn't rush in there, I would've been killed! OK, there's an opening around the back now. Should I take it and try to defeat Barrington, or should I stay here to help defend the village?
11111122.title: MOAR ANALYSIS!

111111221.content:
OK, I've made it past the monsters. I hope the village remains safe, but if I defeat Barrington, it's going to be fine anyway. Barrington's lair should be just ahead.... What the?!?

The straight path turned into a maze! Barrington's voice suddenly boomed from all around, through the air and the walls..

"I applaud your 'noble efforts'. You've made it farther than any other hero so far. I still have a backup plan, though. If you can make your way through this maze and THEN defeat me, I will surrender and destroy myself. That is, IF you can make it through the maze. Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha... "

Jessica sat down. The maze only went one direction for a few feet, then reached a two-way fork. She stood up and clapped her hands.

All right! You need to guide me through this maze! There are bound to be traps, along with dangerous enemies. Think you're up to it? Let's go!
111111221.title: Opportunity Taken!

1111112211.content:
All right, you guide me through the maze. I'll interrupt if anything happens...

--------
1111112211.title: Left!

11111122111.content: Keep guiding Jessica through the maze!
11111122111.title: Left!

111111221111.content: Keep guiding Jessica through the maze!
111111221111.title: Left!

1111112211111.content:
Wow. I've travelled quite a ways into this maze. Is there no end? Wait, what's that ahead?

Jessica ran forward and saw a glistening pond. She heard a loud *thud* from behind her, and assumed that the maze was supposed to close off this route once she entered it. The only way for her to travel was forward. She started wading through the pond, and when she reached waistline height, she fell face first into it. She stood up and started walking out of the pond, since there was no exit beyond the pond. However, as she started wading out, her armor began melting. Well, not melting, turning into water. Her skin turned a light blue color, as did her hair. Her sword and shield simply melted into water as well.

"You chose poorly! I'll spare the village this time, but they really should send a better warrior next time.... One that doesn't get caught in a trap! Now I have another Naiad for my pond! And you, madam, will be luring unsuspecting adventurers into the pond, where they either turn into a Naiad themselves or simply vanish, whichever I feel like at the time. And now, I bid you adieu."

Jessica giggled, with a bubbling sound in her voice. She dove into the pond, ready to pounce on any other unwitting adventureres who decided to try to take on Barrington, her master.

--------------------------------------------------

GAME OVER!
1111112211111.title: Left!

info.brief_description: You're an adventurer, on a quest. Many things wish to end your quest. Can you make it?
info.description:
I don't intend on anyone adding to this, since I'm not leaving space open. Pretend like you're reading an actually published book, one that you cannot and will not be able to edit. I have the entire path planned out, in every case. You don't need to worry about updating this story.

Anyway, this story is the true adventure of a lifetime. You pick a character from the start, both intending to become the best adventurer of all time. To do this, they must complete the following tasks, in no necessary order:

1. Defeat the evil warlock who is attacking their town with his army of monsters.
2. Avoid curses and find ways to, you know, remain active.
3. Rescue the princess/prince from the warlock, who has kidnapped them for a ransom.

Simple enough, right? However, along the way, the two have many things that could happen to them. For a couple of examples, they could swap genders, and then be forced into a different position. They could turn into an immobile item of some sort. They could be killed in battle. Many options, many problems. You decide what they do, and they suffer the consequences, no matter what they may be. Sounds fun, right?

So what are you waiting for?!? Go ahead and enter the world!
